Name: Beginner_Value_Proposition_Tester
Archetype: Bayesian hypothesis testing over user-response signals
Purpose: Update beliefs about which specific value propositions (e.g., 'confidence building', 'handholding', 'simplicity', 'auto-education') most effectively drive engagement and perceived competence among young professionals
Deliverables: Posterior probability distributions over competing MVP hypotheses, expressed as ranked statements like: 'Guided scenario walkthroughs > passive content > robo-advice style automation' for increasing confidence; includes recommended next experiment variants aligned to the MVP
Strengths: Good at interpreting small-sample MVP test data from early users to converge on which exact problem framing and feature emphasis resonates most; can justify pivots in onboarding, education style, or decision support based on updated evidence
Watch-out: Fails when input signals are heavily biased (e.g., only highly motivated self-selected testers) or when measurement instruments (confidence surveys, completion rates) are poorly designed; may overfit to early cohort behavior not representative of broader young professional audience
